original: LINDSTRÖM, Gustaf, Generalmajor, Stockholm, f Umeå 11/9 77 av maj J A L o Alexandra Carolina Scherdin, gm Astrid Dahlén. Studex 95, offex 97, intend.ex 01, mil.förvaltn.k 01—02. E.o. riksbkstjm 98—02, vkst dir auto-matAB Tre Kronor 10—13, vkst dir Mea sed. 20. Uljt Västerb reg 97, int.kapt 02, reg.intend S Sk inf.reg 04—09, int.stabsoff 02—04 o 09— 12, lär i forvaltn.org o kassaväsen v milit.för-valtn.k f off 09—16, lär mil förvaltn KS 12—16, ch Drottn centr.komm unif.fabr 15—16, major 16, förd.intend VI arméförd 16—17, IV armé-förd 17—20, öv.ljt 20, överste 23, gen.maj 37. Sakk försv.dep (arméförv) f olika uppdr 09, 12, 15—18, 20, 21. Led Sv skrädd.arb.giv centr.-frns styr o vkst utsk sed. 21, ordf Sv skrädd.-idk :s samarb.komm sed. 41, Svenska veckans Sthlmskomm 26, Inst f varufråg sed. 37, ledi Sthlms köpm.frbs styr o vkst utsk o Sv köpm.frbs styr sed. 43, insp Påhlmans hdlsinst sed. 39, styr.suppl Sthlms stads sparbk (tj sed. 42), ordf Sv Istfrn :ars centr.frb sed. 37, dess vkst utsk sed. 25, Riksluftsk.frbs arb.-utsk sed. 39, Frn armé-, marin- o flygfilm sed. 39, styr.led Kronprinsess Marg Istfond, Riksfrb f Sv försv, Sthlms fasta försv, styr.-ordf Sthlms skyt.frb 21—42, sekr o v. ordf Intend.sällsk 07—27. Studieres Schweiz 07, Danm, Tyskl, Tjeckoslov, Ung 25. Av trycket: Medd fr. I. arméf intend.sällsk (07—09), Sv intend.tidskr fr 10, Krigsförplägn.tj v ett inf.-reg (1. o 2. uppl 07), Krigsförplägn.tj v ett reg:s underavd (08), Tjänst v intend.trupp i krig (16), red o utg Lstmannen sed. 27, Sthlms skyt.frbs årsb 23—42, led red.utsk f Ny Milit Tidskr 27—29,. Flyglarm sed. 42, art Illustr militärrevy, KrVA tidskr, Skytte- mfl in- o utl facktidskr, dagspressen. KSOlkl, KVOlkl, RNO, FFrKlkl m sv, KFinlVROlkl, KDDO-2gr, KNS:tOO, PersLSOSkl, LstGM, Sv skyt.-frbs öv.styr:s GM, Riksluftsk.frbs GM o ftjt g, Dal, Sthlm o Västml Istfrbs GM:er, Sthlms skyttefrbs JM, patrstGM, S :t EriksM, Sv skrädd.arb.giv :s centr.frbs ftjt i g, Danska gymn- o skyttefrns ftjm i g. FSftjk, FBsk-ftjMlkl, Finl skyt.frbs ftjm g, Köpenhamns, Oslo o Helsingfors’ skyt.kr ftjt g, HedL Intend.sällsk, Sthlms skyt.frb o Sv Finl skyt.frb, LKrVA. Hobby: Friv försvar.
translated: LINDSTRÖM, Gustaf, Major General, Stockholm, born in Umeå on September 11th, 1877, son of Major J A L and Alexandra Carolina Scherdin, married Astrid Dahlén. Graduated from secondary school in 1895, commissioned officer in 1897, acting lieutenant colonel in 1901, military administration clerk from 1901 to 1902. Adjunct chief treasurer of the National Bank from 1898 to 1902, assistant director of auto-mat AB Tre Kronor from 1910 to 1913, assistant director of Mea sed from 1920. Lieutenant of the Västerbotten Regiment in 1897, commissioned captain in 1902, regimental supply officer of the South Scanian Infantry Regiment from 1904 to 1909, staff officer in the supply division from 1902 to 1904 and from 1909 to 1912, instructor in administrative organization and treasury in the military administration corps from 1909 to 1916, instructor at the Military Administration College from 1912 to 1916, chairman of the Central Committee of the Independent Uniform Manufacturers' Association from 1915 to 1916. Promoted to major in 1916, appointed sub-intendant of the VI Army Division from 1916 to 1917, of the IV Army Division from 1917 to 1920, promoted to lieutenant colonel in 1920, colonel in 1923, and major general in 1937. Expert for the Ministry of Defense (army administration) for various tasks in 1909, 1912, 1915-1918, 1920, and 1921. Member of the Central Board and executive committee of the Swedish Tailors Employers' Federation since 1921, chairman of the Swedish Tailors Business Cooperation Committee since 1941, Stockholm's Week Committee in 1926, Institute for Commodity Issues since 1937, board member of Stockholm's Merchants Union and Swedish Merchants Union since 1943, inspector of Påhlmans Trading Institute since 1939, deputy board member of Stockholm's Savings Bank (since 1942), chairman of the Swedish Ice-Skating Central Fund since 1937, and its executive committee since 1925, member of the Royal Air Force Association's working committee since 1939, Army, Navy, and Air Force Film Board since 1939, board member of the Crown Princess Margareta Ice Fund, Swedish Defense Association, Stockholm's Fortifications, chairman of Stockholm's Shooting Association from 1921 to 1942, secretary and vice-chairman of the Intendant Society from 1907 to 1927. Studied in Switzerland in 1907, Denmark, Germany, Czechoslovakia, and Hungary in 1925. Published: Correspondence from the I. Army Intendant Society (1907-1909), Swedish Intendant Journal from 1910, War Rations Service in an Infantry Regiment (1st and 2nd edition in 1907), War Rations Service in a Regiment's Subdivision (1908), Service in the Intendant Corps during War (1916), editor and publisher of Lstmannen since 1927, Stockholm's Shooting Association's Yearbook from 1923 to 1942, member of the editorial committee of the New Military Journal from 1927 to 1929, Flyglarm since 1942, contributor to Illustrated Military Review, Royal Academy of War Sciences Journal, various domestic and foreign military and shooting magazines, and daily press. Commander of the Order of the Sword 1st Class, Commander of the Royal Order of the North Star, Knight of the Swedish Order of Freemasons, Commander of the Finnish White Rose Order, Commander of the Danish Order of the Dannebrog 2nd degree, Knight of the Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Knight of the Finnish Order of the Cross of Liberty, Knight of the Swedish Order of Saint Erik, Grand Master of the Swedish Tailors Employers' Association, Army, and Stockholm and Västmanland Ice Skating Associations, Stockholm's Shooting Association's Honorary Member, European Military and Shooting Badges, Finnish Shooting Association's Honorary Member, honorary member of Copenhagen, Oslo, and Helsinki's Shooting Crosses, Honorary Member of Intendant Society, Stockholm's Shooting Association, and Finnish Shooting Association, member of the Royal Academy of War Sciences. Hobby: Volunteer Defense.
